item.title: Sharp bounds on the failure of the hot spots conjecture
Convex sets can have interior hot spots
item.description:
Authors: Jaume de Dios

Type: Preprint (2024)

arXiv:2412.06344

Abstract

The hot spots conjecture asserts that for any convex bounded domain Ω in R^d, the first non-trivial Neumann eigenfunction of the Laplace operator in Ω attains its maximum at the boundary. We construct counterexamples to the conjecture for all sufficiently large values of d. The construction is based on an extension of the conjecture from convex sets to log-concave measures.

item.title: Predicting quantum channels over general product distributions
item.description:
Authors: Sitan Chen, Jaume de Dios, Jun-Ting Hsieh, Hsin-Yuan Huang, Jane Lange, Jerry Li

Type: Paper (2024)

arXiv:2409.03684

Abstract

We investigate the problem of predicting the output behavior of unknown quantum channels. Given query access to an n-qubit channel E and an observable O, we aim to learn the mapping ρ↦Tr(OE[ρ]) to within a small error for most ρ sampled from a distribution D.

item.title: Periodicity and decidability of translational tilings by rational polygonal sets
item.description:
Authors: Jaume de Dios, José Madrid, Jan Grebík, Rachel Greenfeld

Type: Preprint (2024)

arXiv:2408.02151

Abstract

The periodic tiling conjecture asserts that if a region Σ⊂R^d tiles R^d by translations then it admits at least one fully periodic tiling.

item.title: Query lower bounds for log-concave sampling
item.description:
Authors: Sinho Chewi, Jaume de Dios Pont, Jerry Li, Chen Lu, Shyam Narayanan

Type: Preprint (2023)

arXiv:2304.02599

Abstract

Log-concave sampling has witnessed remarkable algorithmic advances in recent years, but the corresponding problem of proving lower bounds for this task has remained elusive, with lower bounds previously known only in dimension one.

item.title: Uniform Fourier Restriction Estimate for Simple Curves of Bounded Frequency
item.description:
Authors: Jaume de Dios, Helge Jørgen Samuelsen

Type: Preprint (2023)

arXiv:2303.11693

Abstract

In this paper we prove a uniform Fourier restriction estimate over the class of simple curves where the last coordinate function can be written as a polynomial of bounded degree and frequency.

item.title: A new proof of the description of the convex hull of space curves with totally positive torsion
item.description:
Authors: Jaume de Dios, Paata Ivanisvili, José Madrid

Type: Preprint (2022)

arXiv:2201.12932

Abstract

We give new proofs of the description convex hulls of space curves γ:[a,b]→R^d having totally positive torsion.

item.title: Additive energies on discrete cubes
item.description:
Authors: Jaume de Dios, Rachel Greenfeld, Paata Ivanisvili, José Madrid

Type: Preprint (2021)

arXiv:2112.09352

Abstract

We prove that for d≥0 and k≥2, for any subset A of a discrete cube {0,1}^d, the k-higher energy of A is bounded.

item.title: On classical inequalities for autocorrelations and autoconvolutions
item.description:
Authors: Jaume de Dios, José Madrid

Type: Preprint (2021)

arXiv:2106.13873

Abstract

In this paper we study an autocorrelation inequality proposed by Barnard and Steinerberger. The study of these problems is motivated by applications to the Fourier transform.

item.title: Decoupling for fractal subsets of the parabola
item.description:
Authors: Alan Chang, Jaume de Dios, Rachel Greenfeld, Asgar Jamneshan, Zane Kun Li, José Madrid

Type: Preprint (2020)

arXiv:2012.11458

Abstract

We consider decoupling for a fractal subset of the parabola. We reduce studying l^2L^p decoupling for a fractal subset on the parabola to studying decoupling for arithmetic progressions.

item.description:
Authors: Joan Bruna, Jaume de Dios

arXiv:2006.10225

Abstract

The analysis of neural network training beyond their linearization regime remains an outstanding open question, even in the simplest setup of a single hidden-layer.

item.title: A geometric lemma for complex polynomial curves with applications in Fourier restriction theory
item.description:
Authors: Jaume de Dios
